results.title: Manyu-Wana 6 (A)
results.creator_credit: Wendy Baarda, David Batty and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Golf magic; words for ‘first’ and ‘last” reading of “The Emu is looking for water’; story about bush medicine from ghost gum; dreaming story about country around Vaughan Springs; working as an administrative assistant at the school; making a sling-shot for getting birds; school children on a visit to the country of their dreamings, digging for rabbits, traditional dancing and singing about the country. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wendy Baarda, David Batty and Warlpiri Media

results.title: Manyu-Wana 5 (A)
results.creator_credit: Wendy Baarda, David Batty and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Holly magic; words for ‘happy’ and ‘serious’; reading of a “Story about Echidnas”’ number 8; story about a bush potato dreaming place; more on numbers, using doll magic; dreaming stories about places southwest of Yuendumu; boys and girls painted up and doing fire-dreaming dances; good food; bush animals, vegetables, fruits and seeds; working at the shop; bike magic. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wendy Baarda, David Batty and Warlpiri Media

results.title: Manyu-Wana 4 (A)
results.creator_credit: Wendy Baarda, David Batty and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Magic; spear-straightening in a fire and hunting for kangaroo; baby magic; words for ‘big’ and ‘little’ using different clothes being washed; collecting red ochre form a cave at Karrku, near Nyirrpi; working at the powerhouse; picking up rubbish; reading of “The Snake and the Goanna”; band magic; Nyirrpi tractor. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wendy Baarda, David Batty and Warlpiri Media

results.title: Manyu-Wana 3 (A)
results.creator_credit: Wendy Baarda, David Batty and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Children playing; dampers magic-number 6; exercising for health, showing football and basketball matches between communitites; spear-throwing at Yuendumu Sports; reading of “The Story about the Snake and the Mouse”; words for ‘heavy’ and ‘light’; colours; cleaning and grinding of bush seeds for seed cakes. Suitable for Primary, seconday and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with Englsih subtitles.

results.title: Manyu-Wana 2 (A)
results.creator_credit: Wendy Baarda, David Batty and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Working for the Yuendumu Mining Co.; reading of “The Story of the Perentie”; words for ‘far’ and ‘close’; cleaning teeth, washing eyes; fire-making; story about a little kangaroo looking for its mother; shirt magic; number 2. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.

results.title: Manyu-Wana 1 (A)
results.creator_credit: Wendy Baarda, David Batty and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This program contains the following topics: Magic; number 3; working as a stockman; reading of “The Man and the tree”; number 1; blowing noses; letter “M”; making hairstring; words for ‘wide’ and ‘narrow’; car magic; bat and ball magic. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.

results.title: Manyu-Wana (A)
results.brief_description: Set among the red dirt, campfires, rock music and dreaming stories of an Aboriginal community in Central Australia, these programs were produced to help local children learn literacy and maths in their own language, Warlpiri. Scenes around the community, animation, puppet and magic characters are used to introduce letters, syllables, numbers and other maths concepts, and to illustrate story books. Traditional skills and activities are featured in segments on hunting and gathering bush foods, fire-making, traditional ceremonies and painting, and dreamtime stories about the landscape. An Aboriginal “Sesame Street”, this series of programs is suitable for use as a teaching/study resource for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.
results.description: Set among the red dirt, campfires, rock music and dreaming stories of an Aboriginal community in Central Australia, these programs were produced to help local children learn literacy and maths in their own language, Warlpiri. Scenes around the community, animation, puppet and magic characters are used to introduce letters, syllables, numbers and other maths concepts, and to illustrate story books. Traditional skills and activities are featured in segments on hunting and gathering bush foods, fire-making, traditional ceremonies and painting, and dreamtime stories about the landscape. An Aboriginal “Sesame Street”, this series of programs is suitable for use as a teaching/study resource for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.

Scenes around the community, animation, puppet and magic characters are used to introduce letters, syllables, numbers and other maths concepts, and to illustrate story books. Traditional skills and activities are featured in segments on hunting and gathering bush foods, fire-making, traditional ceremonies and painting, and dreamtime stories about the landscape. An Aboriginal “Sesame Street”, this series of programs is suitable for use as a teaching/study resource for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.

results.title: Many Cultures-One Community
results.brief_description: This program looks at the dilemmas faced by many children, teenagers and adults, who are torn between a need to fit in with the Australian way of life and following the customs of their homeland. We meet the members of a Turkish family who share a wide range of problems including a teenage boy who wants to be accepted by his peers, his sister who wants to date boys and his parents who feel that he is ashamed of them and their culture. Issues raised include racism, multiculturalism and assimilation, name calling, the problems of living in a new country, the greater difficulties faced by women, peer group pressure, the generation gap and how migrant parents can cope.

results.title: Many classic moments
results.creator_credit: Da Capo Films, James Sherman and Gary Capo
results.brief_description: ‘Many Classic Moments’ explores the emotional surfing experience of some of the world’s best surfing talent, including Larry Bertleman, Michael Ho, Mark Liddell, Buttons Kaluhiokalani, James Jones and Dane Kealoha. The experiences are linked by their communication of the emotions that make up the thrill of surfing. The tape includes ‘Moments of fear’, ‘Moments of searching and finding’, ‘The Ultimate moment’, as well as a Surf Wars Cartoon.
